sentence: Among the underlying components of the S&P 500 index, we saw noteworthy options trading volume today in Fluor Corp. (Symbol: FLR), where a total of 6,107 contracts have traded so far, representing approximately 610,700 underlying shares.
That amounts to about 57.8% of FLR's average daily trading volume over the past month of 1.1 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $62.50 strike call option expiring May 18, 2018 , with 2,735 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 273,500 underlying shares of FLR.

Below is a chart showing FLR's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $62.50 strike highlighted in orange:

PVH Corp (Symbol: PVH) options are showing a volume of 4,833 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 483,300 underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 53.2% of PVH's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 909,055 shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $130 strike put option expiring April 20, 2018 , with 1,559 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 155,900 underlying shares of PVH.

Below is a chart showing PVH's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $130 strike highlighted in orange:

And Salesforce.com Inc (Symbol: CRM) saw options trading volume of 40,787 contracts, representing approximately 4.1 million underlying shares or approximately 48.5% of CRM's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 8.4 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $115 strike call option expiring June 15, 2018 , with 10,759 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 1.1 million underlying shares of CRM.

Below is a chart showing CRM's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $115 strike highlighted in orange:
